Public
This is the content of the [[$:/_/testtiddler]]
!!Bob
Bob is a plugin for [[TiddlyWiki on Node.js|https://tiddlywiki.com/#TiddlyWiki%20on%20Node.js]], or it can be used as a stand-alone executable that doesn't require any installation. As a main feature, it enables a wiki to be used on ''multiple units'' at the same time without the risk of overwriting tiddlers. This means that;

*''as an individual'', you can leave your wiki open on both your laptop, phone and tablet and edit tiddlers freely
*''as a group'', you can use a wiki for collaboration and several people can edit the wiki simultaneously

Bob is available in two versions that achieve the same things:

*''the Bob'' [[plugin|https://github.com/OokTech/TW5-Bob]] - a TiddlyWiki plugin to install in your current node.js version of TW. 
*''the Bob'' [[.exe file|https://github.com/OokTech/TW5-SingleExecutable/releases]] - a stand alone //single executable file// that you use without installing anything.

The simpler version to use is the second one: You download the executable, place it wherever you want your wikis and then run it.

!!TWederBob
The [[TWederBob plugin|https://www.ooktech.xyz:8443/Public#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2FOokTech%2FTWederBob]] lets you participate in  "internets of TiddlyWikis" (see "TWederation" below).<br>
The TWederBob plugin...

*can be used in both the Node.js version and the single file version of TiddlyWiki.
*does //not// require the Bob plugin for fetching (importing) or pushing (exporting)<br>(...but the source must have Bob and to //push // content to someones server, you obviously need write rights)
*is better complimented with "user interface plugins" to give a context for the imports/exports - e.g a "mailbox", an "app store" etc.


!!TWederation
TWederation ("TiddlyWiki Federation") will be //internets of TiddlyWikis//. It will enable you to communicate with tiddly friends, subscribe to stuff, access plugin repositories, get notified about your outdated plugins, and much more. There can be several such federations.

You can participate in TWederation on three "levels":

*''Import + Export tiddlers'' = ''TW + TWederBob''<br>E.g privately on your local computer or on a wiki hosted on a service like [[TiddlySpot|http://tiddlywiki5.tiddlyspot.com/]].<br>Batch import  tiddlers of interest, e.g tiddlers tagged //@yourname// or tiddlers that mention "your interest", from wikis that have Bob installed.<br>//Exporting// ("pushing") to someones server, requires write rights.
*''Serve tiddlers'' = ''TW + Bob''<br>E.g in a LAN or hosted on a public server.<br>This setup lets others fetch your tiddlers such as your replies in discussions or stuff you have harvested from yet other TWederation connected wikis. If you grant rights to them, they can also //push// tiddlers to you.
*''Fetch, serve '' = ''TW + Bob + TWederBob''<br>Your server can act as a central TWederation hub that collects tiddlers from a list of other tiddlywikis on Bob servers. The tiddlers collected can be set using filters. Other than a registry of particpating member wikis, you might want to host a //discussion forum// or collect //meta data about plugins// in the network or feature "special interest wikis" by collecting all tiddlers that mention some area of interest.

---

*''Import + Export tiddlers'' = ''TW + TWederBob''<br>E.g privately on your local computer or on a wiki hosted on a service like [[TiddlySpot|http://tiddlywiki5.tiddlyspot.com/]].<br>Batch import  tiddlers of interest, e.g tiddlers tagged //@yourname// or tiddlers that mention "your interest", from wikis that have Bob installed.<br>//Exporting// ("pushing") to someones server, requires write rights.
*''Serve tiddlers'' = ''TW + Bob''<br>E.g in a LAN or hosted on a public server.<br>This setup lets others (that use TWederBob) fetch your tiddlers such as your replies in discussions or stuff you have harvested from yet other TWederation connected wikis. If you grant rights to them, they can also //push// tiddlers to you.
*''Network hub'' = ''TW + Bob + TWederBob @@background:pink; +???@@''<br>On your public server, collect and serve tiddlers from other Bob servers.<br>Your server acts as a central TWederation hub that, from a predefined list of other tiddlywikis with Bob installed, collects tiddlers according to filters and then serves these. The collecting can be manual @@background:pink;or automatic@@. For example, you can host a //discussion forum// or //plugin repository// with meta data about plugins in the network, or feature "special interest wikis" by collecting all tiddlers that mention some area of interest.

/* Sticky title dropdowns in front of succeeding tiddlers title field - and edit titlebar in front of top bar  */
.tc-tiddler-frame:hover .tc-tiddler-title { z-index:501; }
.tc-tiddler-frame:hover .tc-tiddler-edit-title { z-index:1200; }







\define datestamp()
<$action-sendmessage
	$message="tm-edit-text-operation"
	$param="wrap-lines"
	prefix="@@color:gray; //$(dateStamp)$//@@

*"
	suffix=""
/>
\end

<$vars dateStamp=<<now "0DD MMM">>>
<<datestamp>>
</$vars>







@@color:gray; //03 September//@@

*ya' know; it should be possible to create interest already now: Anyone who installs TWederBob in their wiki can fetch "the TW thought of the day" as provided by us or, if you don't have time, even just me. I have a zillion bits of tiddly stuff in my head. TWederBob is a great gateway for all else considering how it is a single plugin that is directly usable. If there is also desirable content accessible via it.... well that should attract people //and// it would work as an information/marketing channel about TWederation itself!!!
*I made a simple ''Notification system'' and an outline for how people can ''collaboratively develop'' tiddlers. See http://mybob.tiddlyspot.com/
*For the Notification system, there needs to be a way to distinguish newly fetched tiddlers from others;
**Maybe fetching can add a temporary list akin to the "Imported tiddlers" tidder?
**...but the idea with the Notifications area is that titles stay there until dismissed (e.g checked off or navigated to), so maybe fetching should generate a hard coded list where dismissing means the title-string is erased in that list... 
*It struck me that since I use the SideEditor... will a tiddler being edited not be locked in TWederBob then?
*I note that fetching overwrites silently. There should probably be a warning for this - but it is also pretty cool that you can stare on a tid while fetching and it updates.

@@color:gray; //02 September//@@

*I set up http://mybob.tiddlyspot.com/ - but it doesn't work to fetch from, into my local TW (which has only TWederBob). Do I misundersand something or is the "second participation level" noted in the [[$:/_dev/Quick Concept Intro]] not possible with tiddlyspot? (I'm guessing it doesn't work because the nodejs parts are obviously not uploaded...)
*alert mechanism: OK, a fetch-based system but with  UI like the following would be "concise" enough IMO: The user clicks a single button, e.g an icon up in the topbar that does the fecthing. If anything in deed was fetched, then it changes colour. This button somehow also servs as a link to, or a dropdown button to, a notification area where all fetched stuff is listed. I can work on this if you like the idea.
@@color:gray; //01 September//@@

*Just fyi, the current login UI is a bit confusing i.e what the current //status// is: I know about the 24h expiry but IMO there should be some indicator on //this// display of the wiki that I'm logged in, not only on https://ooktech.xyz:8443/
**If you want, I can make some login indicator to show in the topbar if I just know how to check for login status. Is the status value stored in some status tiddler so that it can be checked with a listwidget?
*Further, if I'm not mistaken, the "you're logged in" indicators (green frame etc) on that site remain even when I'm ejected, unless reloading! I'd wish the indicators really reflected the status.  
@@color:gray; //31 August//@@

*I'm already feeling that it is frustrating to not know if someone has replied to something, so see a need for notifications of some kind (...to email? sms? my home wiki? not sure). (from @jed - I made an [[$:/@mat]] tiddler to respond, the comments plugin in 5.1.18 should help a lot when it comes out)
@@color:gray; //29 August//@@

*should I hide this and other tiddlers during "dev/discussion" by using $:/ prefix?
*I find no official download place for TWederBob so linked to [[here|https://www.ooktech.xyz:8443/Public#%24%3A%2Fplugins%2FOokTech%2FTWederBob]]
*please disable CamelCase linking as it creates unwanted links that have to be manually edited away
*please activate titles as links (IMO it is common tiddly courtesy ;-)
*what kind of things are OK that I do in this wiki? For example, I added $:/./ui/EditorToolbar/datestamp
*the TWederBob plugin has descriptive name "A plugin to add federation via Bob servers"
**considering that "Bob servers" is not a direct concern for the absolute majority of TWederBob users (any more than "web servers" are a direct concern for web surfers) this should not be mentioned there because it risks confusing people, IMO
**What actually is a "Bob server". Is it that thing that you've not yet published? Or does it refer to the Bob plugin somehow?






@@color:gray; //05 September//@@

* Different browsers have different methods of handling cookies and local storage and I haven't found a way that works across browsers to check the login status. I have some ideas but I haven't had a chance to try them out yet. Until then the login widget is going to lie sometimes.
* I don't have a login indicator on every wiki. I can look at making something to indicate login status on each wiki. For everything but the public wiki you have to be logged in to see the wiki itself so I hadn't considered the problem of not knowing if you are logged in or not on the public wiki.
* Some notification about things being fetched would be nice, but it may take some javascript coding to expose that part. I have some similar things set up with Bob for syncing so I may be able to add that in.
* TWEDERBOB IS NOT BOB. You can only pull from Bob servers, adding twederbob doesn't let you pull from the wiki with the twederbob plugin, it lets you pull from properly configured Bob servers. TWederBob works with Bob, TWederBob isn't anything useful by itself.
* Fetching may in the future use tiddler bundles or something like TWederation to prevent copying over tiddlers without meaning to.
* Side editor will not give you the same protections about not overwriting someones edits as the normal editor will. We can look into modifying the side editor so that when you have it active for a tiddler it sets the tiddler as being edited the same way as the normal edit button does, that would probably not be too terribly difficult and shouldn't cause problems on non-bob wikis.
* I am not sure what your fetch thing on mybob.tiddlyspot.com does, I will have to look closer when I have more time.
* A thought of the day thing sounds good to me. But it would have to come from a Bob server. So the 'thought of the day' could come from the public wiki on ooktech.xyz, but it couldn't come from any wiki on tiddlyspot because they don't use Bob. If you want to set that up go ahead. The simplest way would be to modify the fetch demo to pull the most recent tiddler with the `Thought of the Day` tag, or whatever tag would be appropriate for it.



@@color:gray; //31 August//@@

* I am not sure what alert mechanism would be good to use here. SMS is very difficult, email less so but still not easy. Making you your own wiki and having it pull in messages may be the quickest way but it would require some more plugins to work.

@@color:gray; //30 August//@@

* The TWederBob plugin only pushes or fetches from/to a wiki served by Bob.
** the fetching/pushing wiki needs the TWederBob plugin, but it doesn't let you push or fetch from the wiki that has the plugin.
* Bob servers are of direct concern because they are necessary to the process. Without them the TWederBob plugin doesn't do anything.
* A Bob server is the server that is added by the Bob plugin and used whenever you use a wiki with Bob. Or the server that is currently serving this wiki online.






.bm-table {margin:0 auto;}
.bm-table, .bm-table th, .bm-table td {
  border:0; background:white;
}
.bm-input-table {width:100%;}
.bm-input-table > tr > td:nth-child(2) {max-width:300px;}
.bm-input-table select {max-width:calc(100% - 50px - 1.2em);}
.bm-fieldeditor {max-width:calc(100% - 1.2em);}

.bm-relations-table {margin-top:4em;}
.bm-table th.rotate {
  white-space: nowrap;
  vertical-align:bottom;
}
.bm-table th.rotate > div {
  transform: translate(27px, -.5em) rotate(315deg);
  width: 1em;
  margin-left:-1em;
}
.bm-table th.rotate > div > span {
  border-bottom: 1px solid #ccc;
  padding: 0px 10px 2px 0;
  margin-left:-.6em;
  background:white;
}
.bm-table ::-webkit-input-placeholder { color: #a6a6a6; }
.bm-table :-ms-input-placeholder { color: #a6a6a6; }
.bm-table ::-ms-input-placeholder { color: #a6a6a6; }
.bm-table ::-moz-placeholder { color: #a6a6a6; }

.bm-singledata-table-head {border-bottom:2px solid silver}

.bm-btn {width:1em;}
.bm-btn-addtofilter {color:blue; }
.bm-btn-add, .tm-add-tag, .tm-add-field { background:lightgray;}
.bm-btn-remove, .tm-remove-tag, .tm-remove-field {background:lightgreen;}
.peek {display:none;z-index:2;background-color:lightgray;position:absolute;}
.peek-hover:hover .peek {display:block; background:lightgray;}
.bm-tooltip {position:absolute; display:none; z-index:2;background:white; margin:-2.6em -1em; border:1px solid silver; padding:0 5px; color:black;white-space:nowrap;}
.bm-btn-tooltip:hover .bm-tooltip {display:block;}
.bm-fontsmall {font-size:.8em; fill:gray;}
.bm-center {text-align:center; vertical-align:text-bottom;}
.bm-fontsmall svg,
 .bm-fontsmall input[type="checkbox"] {vertical-align:text-top}
.bm-alert {border-color:red;}

.bm-drag {background:#ec6; border-radius:1em; padding:0; line-height:1.1em; width:3em; display:inline-block;}
button.green-link {color:#00cc00;}
