Each hook sends a\n      message to the node process.\n\n      Some unused hooks have commented out skeletons for adding those hooks in\n      the future if they are needed.\n    */\n    var addHooks = function() {\n      if (!$tw.wikiName) {\n        $tw.wikiName = '';\n      }\n      $tw.hooks.addHook(\"th-editing-tiddler\", function(event) {\n        var token = localStorage.getItem('ws-token')\n        var message = {type: 'editingTiddler', tiddler: {fields: {title: event.tiddlerTitle}}, wiki: $tw.wikiName, token: token};\n        sendToServer(message);\n        // do the normal editing actions for the event\n        return true;\n      });\n      $tw.hooks.addHook(\"th-cancelling-tiddler\", function(event) {\n        var token = localStorage.getItem('ws-token')\n        var message = {type: 'cancelEditingTiddler', tiddler:{fields:{title: event.tiddlerTitle}}, wiki: $tw.wikiName, token: token};\n        sendToServer(message);\n        // Do the normal handling\n        return event;\n      });\n      $tw.hooks.addHook(\"th-renaming-tiddler\", function (event) {\n        // For some reason this wasn't being handled by the generic 'change'\n        // event. So the hook is here.\n        console.log('renaming tiddler');\n        console.log(event)\n      });\n      /*\n        Listen out for changes to tiddlers\n        This handles tiddlers that are edited directly or made using things\n        like the setfield widget.\n        This ignores tiddlers that are in the exclude filter\n      */\n    \t$tw.wiki.addEventListener(\"change\",function(changes) {\n        for (var tiddlerTitle in changes) {\n          // If the changed tiddler is the one that holds the exclude filter\n          // than update the exclude filter.\n          if (tiddlerTitle === '$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/ExcludeSync') {\n            $tw.Bob.ExcludeFilter = $tw.wiki.getTiddlerText('$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/ExcludeSync');\n          }\n          var list = $tw.wiki.filterTiddlers($tw.Bob.ExcludeFilter);\n          if (list.indexOf(tiddlerTitle) === -1) {\n            if (changes[tiddlerTitle].modified) {\n              var token = localStorage.getItem('ws-token')\n              var tiddler = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(tiddlerTitle);\n              if (tiddler) {\n                var tempTid = {fields:{}};\n                Object.keys(tiddler.fields).forEach(function (field) {\n                    if (field !== 'created' && field !== 'modified') {\n                      tempTid.fields[field] = tiddler.fields[field];\n                    } else {\n                      tempTid.fields[field] = $tw.utils.stringifyDate(tiddler.fields[field]);\n                    }\n                  }\n                );\n                var message = {type: 'saveTiddler', tiddler: tempTid, wiki: $tw.wikiName, token: token};\n                sendToServer(message);\n              }\n            } else if (changes[tiddlerTitle].deleted) {\n              var token = localStorage.getItem('ws-token')\n              var message = {type: 'deleteTiddler', tiddler:{fields:{title:tiddlerTitle}} , wiki: $tw.wikiName, token: token};\n              sendToServer(message);\n            }\n          } else {\n            // Stop the dirty indicator from turning on.\n            $tw.utils.toggleClass(document.body,\"tc-dirty\",false);\n          }\n        }\n    \t});\n\n      $tw.Bob.Reconnect = function (sync) {\n        if ($tw.connections[0].socket.readyState !== 1) {\n          $tw.Bob.setup();\n          if (sync) {\n            $tw.Bob.syncToServer();\n          }\n        }\n      }\n      $tw.Bob.syncToServer = function () {\n        // Use a timeout to ensure that the websocket is ready\n        if ($tw.connections[0].socket.readyState !== 1) {\n          setTimeout($tw.Bob.syncToServer, 100)\n          console.log('waiting')\n        } else {\n          /*\n          // The process here should be:\n\n            Send the full list of changes from the browser to the server in a\n            special message\n            The server determines if any conflicts exist and marks the tiddlers as appropriate\n            If there are no conflicts than it just applies the changes from the browser/server\n            If there are than it marks the tiddler as needing resolution and both versions are made available\n            All connected browsers now see the tiddlers marked as in conflict and resolution is up to the people\n\n            This message is sent to the server, once the server receives it it respons with a special ack for it, when the browser receives that it deletes the unsent tiddler\n\n            What is a conflict?\n\n            If both sides say to delete the same tiddler there is no conflict\n            If one side says save and the othre delete there is a conflict\n            if both sides say save there is a conflict if the two saved versions\n            aren't the same.\n          */\n          // Get the tiddler with the info about local changes\n          var tiddler = $tw.wiki.getTiddler('$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/Unsent');\n          // Ask the server for a listing of changes since the browser was\n          // disconnected\n          var token = localStorage.getItem('ws-token');\n          var message = {type: 'syncChanges', since: tiddler.fields.start, changes: tiddler.fields.text, wiki: $tw.wikiName, token: token};\n          sendToServer(message);\n        }\n      }\n      /*\n        Below here are skeletons for adding new actions to existing hooks.\n        None are needed right now but the skeletons may help later.\n\n        Other available hooks are:\n        th-importing-tiddler\n        th-relinking-tiddler\n        th-renaming-tiddler\n      */\n      /*\n        This handles the hook for importing tiddlers.\n      */\n      /*\n      $tw.hooks.addHook(\"th-importing-tiddler\", function (tiddler) {\n        return tiddler;\n      });\n      */\n      /*\n        For the th-saving-tiddler hook send the saveTiddler message along with\n        the tiddler object.\n      */\n      /*\n      $tw.hooks.addHook(\"th-saving-tiddler\",function(tiddler) {\n        // do the normal saving actions for the event\n        return tiddler;\n      });\n      */\n      /*\n        For the th-deleting-tiddler hook send the deleteTiddler message along\n        with the tiddler object.\n      */\n      /*\n      $tw.hooks.addHook(\"th-deleting-tiddler\",function(tiddler) {\n        // do the normal deleting actions for the event\n        return true;\n      });\n      */\n      /*\n      $tw.hooks.addHook(\"th-new-tiddler\", function(event) {\n        console.log(\"new tiddler hook: \", event);\n        return event;\n      })\n      $tw.hooks.addHook(\"th-navigating\", function(event) {\n        console.log(\"navigating event: \",event);\n        return event;\n      })\n      */\n    }\n    // Send the message to node using the websocket\n    $tw.Bob.setup();\n  }\n})();\n",
            "type": "application/javascript",
            "module-type": "startup"
        },
        "$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/NodeMessageHandlers.js": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/NodeMessageHandlers.js",
            "text": "/*\\\ntitle: $:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/NodeMessageHandlers.js\ntype: application/javascript\nmodule-type: startup\n\nThese are message handler functions for the web socket servers. Use this file\nas a template for extending the web socket funcitons.\n\nThis handles messages sent to the node process.\n\\*/\n(function(){\n\n/*jslint node: true, browser: true */\n/*global $tw: false */\n\"use strict\";\n\nexports.platforms = [\"node\"];\n\nif ($tw.node) {\n  $tw.connections = $tw.connections || [];\n  $tw.Bob = $tw.Bob || {};\n  $tw.Bob.Shared = require('$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/SharedFunctions.js');\n  // This lets you add to the $tw.nodeMessageHandlers object without overwriting\n  // existing handler functions\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers = $tw.nodeMessageHandlers || {};\n  // Ensure that the browser tiddler list object exists without overwriting an\n  // existing copy.\n  $tw.BrowserTiddlerList = $tw.BrowserTiddlerList || {};\n\n  var sendAck = function (data) {\n    if (data.id) {\n      if (data.source_connection !== undefined && data.source_connection !== -1) {\n        $tw.connections[data.source_connection].socket.send(JSON.stringify({type: 'ack', id: data.id}));\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This handles when the browser sends the list of all tiddlers that currently\n    exist in the browser version of the wiki. This is different than the list of\n    all tiddlers in files.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.browserTiddlerList = function(data) {\n    // Save the list of tiddlers in the browser as part of the $tw object so it\n    // can be used elsewhere.\n    $tw.BrowserTiddlerList[data.source_connection] = data.titles;\n    $tw.CreateSettingsTiddlers(data.wiki);\n    $tw.connections[data.source_connection].wikiName = data.wiki;\n    sendAck(data);\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This is just a test function to make sure that everthing is working.\n    It displays the contents of the received data in the console.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.test = function(data) {\n    console.log(data);\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This responds to a ping from the browser. This is used to check and make sure\n    that the browser and server are connected.\n    It also echos back any data that was sent. This is used by the heartbeat to\n    make sure that the server and browser are still connected.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.ping = function(data) {\n    var message = {};\n    //var message = {type: 'pong'};\n    Object.keys(data).forEach(function (key) {\n      message[key] = data[key];\n    })\n    message.type = 'pong';\n    if (data.heartbeat) {\n      message.heartbeat = true;\n    }\n    // When the server receives a ping it sends back a pong.\n    var response = JSON.stringify(message);\n    $tw.connections[data.source_connection].socket.send(response);\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This handles saveTiddler messages sent from the browser.\n\n    TODO: Determine if we always want to ignore draft tiddlers.\n\n    Waiting lists are per-connection so use regular titles.\n    Editing lists are global so need prefixes\n    Saving uses normal titles\n    $tw.boot uses prefixed titles\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.saveTiddler = function(data) {\n    // Make sure there is actually a tiddler sent\n    if (data.tiddler) {\n      // Make sure that the tiddler that is sent has fields\n      if (data.tiddler.fields) {\n        // Ignore draft tiddlers\n        if (!data.tiddler.fields['draft.of']) {\n          var prefix = data.wiki || '';\n          var internalTitle = '{' + prefix + '}' + data.tiddler.fields.title;\n          // Set the saved tiddler as no longer being edited. It isn't always\n          // being edited but checking eacd time is more complex than just\n          // always setting it this way and doesn't benifit us.\n          $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.cancelEditingTiddler({tiddler:{fields:{title:internalTitle}}, wiki: prefix});\n          // If we are not expecting a save tiddler event than save the\n          // tiddler normally.\n          if (!$tw.boot.files[internalTitle]) {\n            $tw.syncadaptor.saveTiddler(data.tiddler, prefix);\n          } else {\n            // If changed send tiddler\n            var changed = true;\n            try {\n              if (data.tiddler.fields._canonical_uri) {\n                var tiddlerObject = $tw.loadTiddlersFromFile($tw.boot.files[internalTitle].filepath+'.meta');\n              } else {\n                var tiddlerObject = $tw.loadTiddlersFromFile($tw.boot.files[internalTitle].filepath);\n              }\n              // The file has the normal title so use the normal title here.\n              changed = $tw.Bob.Shared.TiddlerHasChanged(data.tiddler, tiddlerObject);\n            } catch (e) {\n              //console.log(e);\n            }\n            if (changed) {\n              $tw.syncadaptor.saveTiddler(data.tiddler, prefix);\n              // Set the wiki as modified\n              $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].modified = true;\n            }\n          }\n          delete $tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers[internalTitle];\n          $tw.Bob.UpdateEditingTiddlers(false);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n    // Acknowledge the message.\n    sendAck(data);\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This is the handler for when the browser sends the deleteTiddler message.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.deleteTiddler = function(data) {\n    //console.log('Node Delete Tiddler');\n    data.tiddler = data.tiddler || {};\n    data.tiddler.fields = data.tiddler.fields || {};\n    var title = data.tiddler.fields.title;\n    if (title) {\n      // Make the internal name\n      title = '{' + data.wiki + '}' + title;\n      // Delete the tiddler file from the file system\n      $tw.syncadaptor.deleteTiddler(title);\n      // Set the wiki as modified\n      $tw.Bob.Wikis[data.wiki].modified = true;\n      // Remove the tiddler from the list of tiddlers being edited.\n      if ($tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers[title]) {\n        delete $tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers[title];\n        $tw.Bob.UpdateEditingTiddlers(false);\n      }\n    }\n    // Acknowledge the message.\n    sendAck(data);\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This is the handler for when a browser sends the editingTiddler message.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.editingTiddler = function(data) {\n    data.tiddler = data.tiddler || {};\n    data.tiddler.fields = data.tiddler.fields || {};\n    var title = data.tiddler.fields.title;\n    if (title) {\n      var internalName = '{' + data.wiki + '}' + title;\n      // Add the tiddler to the list of tiddlers being edited to prevent multiple\n      // people from editing it at the same time.\n      $tw.Bob.UpdateEditingTiddlers(internalName);\n    }\n    // Acknowledge the message.\n    sendAck(data);\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This is the handler for when a browser stops editing a tiddler.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.cancelEditingTiddler = function(data) {\n    data.tiddler = data.tiddler || {};\n    data.tiddler.fields = data.tiddler.fields || {};\n    var title = data.tiddler.fields.title;\n    if (title) {\n      // Make sure that the tiddler title is a string\n      if (title.startsWith(\"Draft of '\")) {\n        title = title.slice(10,-1);\n      }\n      var internalName = '{' + data.wiki + '}' + title;\n      // Remove the current tiddler from the list of tiddlers being edited.\n      if ($tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers[internalName]) {\n        delete $tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers[internalName];\n      }\n      $tw.Bob.UpdateEditingTiddlers(false);\n    }\n    // Acknowledge the message.\n    sendAck(data);\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This is for resyncing with a wiki that was disconnected and has reconnected\n    The data object should have the form:\n    {\n      type: 'syncChanges',\n      since: startTime,\n      changes: messageQueue,\n      wiki: wikiName,\n      token: token,\n      id: messageID,\n      source_connection: connectionIndex\n    }\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.syncChanges = function(data) {\n    // Make sure that the wiki that the syncing is for is actually loaded\n    // TODO make sure that this works for wikis that are under multiple levels\n    $tw.ServerSide.loadWiki(data.wiki, $tw.settings.wikis[data.wiki]);\n    // Make sure that the server history exists\n    $tw.Bob.ServerHistory = $tw.Bob.ServerHistory || {};\n    $tw.Bob.ServerHistory[data.wiki] = $tw.Bob.ServerHistory[data.wiki] || [];\n    // Get the received message queue\n    var queue = [];\n    try {\n      queue = JSON.parse(data.changes);\n    } catch (e) {\n      console.log(\"Can't parse server changes!!\");\n    }\n    // Only look at changes more recent than when the browser disconnected\n    var recentServer = $tw.Bob.ServerHistory[data.wiki].filter(function(entry) {\n      return entry.timestamp > data.since;\n    })\n    var conflicts = [];\n    // Iterate through the received queue\n    queue.forEach(function(messageData) {\n      // Find the serverEntry for the tiddler the current message is for, if\n      // any.\n      var serverEntry = recentServer.find(function(entry) {\n        return entry.title === messageData.title\n      })\n      // If the tiddler has an entry check if it is a conflict.\n      // Both deleting the tiddler is not a conflict, both saving the same\n      // changes is not a conflict, otherwise it is.\n      if (serverEntry) {\n        if (messageData.type !== serverEntry.type) {\n          // Different message types between server and browser => conflict\n          conflicts.push(messageData.title);\n        } else if (messageData.type === 'saveTiddler' && serverEntry.type === 'saveTiddler') {\n          // Server and browser are both save => conflict if the two tiddlers\n          // aren't the same.\n          var tempTid = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(messageData.message.tiddler));\n          tempTid.fields.title = '{'+data.wiki+'}'+messageData.title;\n          var serverTiddler = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(tempTid.fields.title);\n          if ($tw.Bob.Shared.TiddlerHasChanged(serverTiddler, tempTid)) {\n            conflicts.push(messageData.title);\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    });\n    // Take care of all the messages that aren't conflicting\n    // First from the received queue\n    queue.forEach(function(messageData){\n      if (conflicts.indexOf(messageData.title) === -1) {\n        // Send the message to the handler with the appropriate setup\n        $tw.Bob.handleMessage.call($tw.connections[data.source_connection].socket, JSON.stringify(messageData.message));\n      }\n    });\n    // Then from the server side\n    recentServer.forEach(function(messageData) {\n      if (conflicts.indexOf(messageData.title) === -1) {\n        var message = {type: messageData.type, wiki: data.wiki}\n        if (messageData.type === 'saveTiddler') {\n          var longTitle = '{'+data.wiki+'}'+messageData.title;\n          var tempTid = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(longTitle);\n          var tiddler = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(tempTid));\n          tiddler.fields.title = messageData.title;\n          // Making the copy above does something that breaks the date fields\n          if (tempTid.fields.created) {\n            tiddler.fields.created = $tw.utils.stringifyDate(tempTid.fields.created);\n          }\n          if (tempTid.fields.modified) {\n            tiddler.fields.modified = $tw.utils.stringifyDate(tempTid.fields.modified);\n          }\n        } else {\n          var tiddler = {fields:{title:messageData.title}}\n        }\n        message.tiddler = tiddler;\n        $tw.Bob.SendToBrowser($tw.connections[data.source_connection], message)\n      }\n    });\n    // Then do something with the conflicts\n    // I think that we need a new message, something like 'conflictingEdits'\n    // that sends the tiddler info from the server to the browser and the\n    // browser takes care of the rest.\n    conflicts.forEach(function(title) {\n      var serverEntry = recentServer.find(function(entry) {\n        return entry.title === title;\n      });\n      if (serverEntry) {\n        var message;\n        if (serverEntry.type === 'saveTiddler') {\n          var longTitle = '{'+data.wiki+'}'+serverEntry.title;\n          var tiddler = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(longTitle);\n          message = {type: 'conflict', message: 'saveTiddler', tiddler: tiddler};\n        } else if (serverEntry.type === 'deleteTiddler') {\n          message = {type: 'conflict', message: 'deleteTiddler', tiddler: {fields:{title:serverEntry.title}}};\n        }\n        if (message) {\n          $tw.Bob.SendToBrowser($tw.connections[data.source_connection], message);\n        }\n      }\n    })\n    // Acknowledge the message.\n    sendAck(data);\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This lets us restart the tiddlywiki server without having to use the command\n    line.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.restartServer = function(data) {\n    if ($tw.node) {\n      console.log('Restarting Server!');\n      // Close web socket server.\n      $tw.wss.close(function () {\n        console.log('Closed WSS');\n      });\n      // This bit of magic restarts whatever node process is running. In this\n      // case the tiddlywiki server.\n      require('child_process').spawn(process.argv.shift(), process.argv, {\n        cwd: process.cwd(),\n        detached: false,\n        stdio: \"inherit\"\n      });\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This lets us shutdown the server from within the wiki.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.shutdownServer = function(data) {\n    console.log('Shutting down server.');\n    // TODO figure out if there are any cleanup tasks we should do here.\n    // Sennd message to parent saying server is shutting down\n    process.exit();\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This updates the settings.json file based on the changes that have been made\n    in the browser.\n    TODO update this to work with child wikis\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.saveSettings = function(data) {\n    if (!path) {\n      var path = require('path');\n      var fs = require('fs');\n    }\n    var prefix = '{'+data.wiki+'}';\n    // Get first tiddler to start out\n    var tiddler = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(prefix + '$:/WikiSettings/split');\n    var settings = JSON.stringify(buildSettings(tiddler, prefix), \"\", 2);\n    // Update the settings tiddler in the wiki.\n    var tiddlerFields = {\n      title: prefix + '$:/WikiSettings',\n      text: settings,\n      type: 'application/json'\n    };\n    // Add the tiddler\n    $tw.wiki.addTiddler(new $tw.Tiddler(tiddlerFields));\n    // Push changes out to the browsers\n    var tiddlerFields2 = {\n      title: '$:/WikiSettings',\n      text: settings,\n      type: 'application/json'\n    };\n    $tw.Bob.SendToBrowsers({type: 'saveTiddler', tiddler: {fields: tiddlerFields2}});\n    // Save the updated settings\n    var userSettingsPath = path.join($tw.boot.wikiPath, 'settings', 'settings.json');\n    if (!fs.existsSync(userSettingsPath)) {\n      // Create the settings folder\n      fs.mkdirSync(userSettingsPath);\n    }\n    fs.writeFile(userSettingsPath, settings, {encoding: \"utf8\"}, function (err) {\n      if (err) {\n        console.log(err);\n      } else {\n        console.log('Wrote settings file')\n      }\n    });\n    // Update the $tw.settings object\n    // First clear the settings\n    $tw.settings = {};\n    // Put the updated version in.\n    $tw.updateSettings($tw.settings, JSON.parse(settings));\n\n    $tw.CreateSettingsTiddlers();\n  }\n\n  function buildSettings (tiddler, prefix) {\n    var settings = {};\n    if (tiddler) {\n      if (tiddler.fields) {\n        var object = (typeof tiddler.fields.text === 'string')?JSON.parse(tiddler.fields.text):tiddler.fields.text;\n        Object.keys(object).forEach(function (field) {\n          if (typeof object[field] === 'string' || typeof object[field] === 'number') {\n            if (String(object[field]).startsWith('$:/WikiSettings/split')) {\n              // Recurse!\n              var newTiddler = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(prefix + object[field]);\n              settings[field] = buildSettings(newTiddler, prefix);\n            } else {\n              // Actual thingy!\n              settings[field] = object[field];\n            }\n          } else {\n            settings[field] = \"\";\n          }\n        });\n      }\n    }\n    return settings;\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This message lets you run a script defined in the settings.json file.\n    You name and define the script there and then you can run it using this.\n\n    The script must be listed in the settings. You send the script name with the\n    message and then it takes the information for it from the settings file.\n\n    settings file entries should be like this:\n\n    \"name\": \"somecommand argument argument\"\n\n    it would be easiest to write a script and then just call the script using\n    this.\n\n    If sequential is set to true than each script will only run after the\n    previous script has finished in the order they are received.\n    It is possible to run non-sequential scripts and sequential scripts\n    simultaneously.\n  */\n  // This holds\n  var scriptQueue = {};\n  var scriptActive = {};\n  var childproc = false;\n  // This function checks if a script is currently running, if not it runs the\n  // next script in the queue.\n  function processScriptQueue (queue) {\n    if (!scriptActive[queue] && scriptQueue[queue].length > 0) {\n      childproc = require('child_process').spawn(scriptQueue[queue][0].command, scriptQueue[queue][0].args, scriptQueue[queue][0].options);\n      scriptActive[queue] = true;\n      childproc.on('error', function (err) {\n        clearQueue(queue);\n        console.log('Script error: ', err);\n      })\n      childproc.on('exit', function () {\n        // Remove the finished task from the queue\n        if (scriptQueue[queue].length > 0) {\n          scriptQueue[queue].shift();\n        }\n        // Set the queue as inactive\n        scriptActive[queue] = false;\n        // Process the next task in the queue, if any.\n        processScriptQueue(queue);\n      });\n    }\n  }\n  function clearQueue (queue) {\n    scriptQueue[queue] = [];\n    if (scriptActive[queue]) {\n      childproc.kill('SIGINT');\n    }\n  }\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.runScript = function (data) {\n    if (data.name) {\n      if ($tw.settings.scripts) {\n        if ($tw.settings.scripts[data.name]) {\n          if (typeof $tw.settings.scripts[data.name] === 'string') {\n            var splitThing = $tw.settings.scripts[data.name].split(\" \");\n            var command = splitThing.shift(),\n            args = splitThing || [],\n            options = {\n              cwd: process.cwd(),\n              detached: false,\n              stdio: \"inherit\"\n            };\n            // If a command has an item that matches a property in the input\n            // object than replace it with the value from the input object.\n            Object.keys(data).forEach(function(item) {\n              var index = args.indexOf(item);\n              if (index !== -1) {\n                args[index] = data[item];\n              }\n            });\n            if (data.sequential) {\n              data.queue = data.queue || 0;\n              scriptActive[data.queue] = scriptActive[data.queue] || false;\n              scriptQueue[data.queue] = scriptQueue[data.queue] || [];\n              // Add the current script to the queue\n              scriptQueue[data.queue].push({command: command, args: args, options: options, queue: data.queue});\n              // Process the queue to run a command\n              processScriptQueue(data.queue);\n            } else {\n              childproc = require('child_process').spawn(command, args, options);\n              childproc.on('error', function (err) {\n                console.log('Script error: ', err);\n              })\n            }\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n  // Stop any currently running script queues\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.stopScripts = function (data) {\n    data.queue = data.queue || 0;\n    clearQueue(data.queue);\n  }\n\n  // This updates what wikis are being served and where they are being served\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.updateRoutes = function (data) {\n    // This is only usable on the root wiki!\n    if (data.wiki === 'RootWiki') {\n      // Then clear all the routes to the non-root wiki\n      $tw.httpServer.clearRoutes();\n      // The re-add all the routes from the settings\n      // This reads the settings so we don't need to give it any arguments\n      $tw.httpServer.addOtherRoutes();\n    }\n  }\n\n  // This builds a single file html version of the current wiki.\n  // This is a simplifed version of the renderTiddler command because I\n  // couldn't figure out how to just call that command here.\n  // TODO let people give an include filter that can build a wiki from tiddlers\n  // drawn from any of the served wikis.\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.buildHTMLWiki = function (data) {\n    console.log('Build Wiki')\n    var path = require('path')\n    var fs = require('fs')\n    var wikiPath, fullName, excludeList;\n    if (data.buildWiki) {\n      var exists = $tw.httpServer.loadWiki(data.buildWiki);\n      if (exists) {\n        wikiPath = $tw.Bob.Wikis[data.buildWiki].wikiPath || undefined;\n        fullName = data.buildWiki;\n      }\n    } else {\n      wikiPath = $tw.Bob.Wikis[data.wiki].wikiPath;\n      fullName = data.wiki\n    }\n    if (data.excludeList) {\n      // Get the excludeList from the provided filter, if it exists\n      excludeList = $tw.wiki.filterTiddlers(data.excludeList);\n    } else {\n      // Otherwise we want to ignore the server-specific plugins to keep things\n      // small.\n      excludeList = ['$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob', '$:/plugins/tiddlywiki/filesystem', '$:/plugins/tiddlywiki/tiddlyweb'];\n    }\n    if (wikiPath) {\n      var outputFolder = data.outputFolder || 'output';\n      var outputName = data.outputName || 'index.html';\n      var outputFile = path.resolve(wikiPath, outputFolder, outputName);\n      $tw.utils.createFileDirectories(outputFile);\n      // tiddlers for this wiki.\n      var options = {\n        variables: {\n          wikiTiddlers:\n            $tw.Bob.Wikis[fullName].tiddlers.concat($tw.Bob.Wikis[fullName].plugins.concat($tw.Bob.Wikis[fullName].themes)).map(function(tidInfo) {\n              // This prevents the Bob plugin from being added to the wiki\n              // It also strips out the filesystem and tiddlyweb plugins\n              if (excludeList.indexOf(tidInfo) === -1) {\n                return '[[' + tidInfo + ']]';\n              } else {\n                return '';\n              }\n            }).join(' '),\n          wikiName: fullName\n        }\n      };\n      var text = $tw.wiki.renderTiddler('text/plain','$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/save/single', options);\n      fs.writeFile(outputFile,text,\"utf8\",function(err) {\n        if (err) {\n            console.log(err);\n          } else {\n            console.log('Built Wiki: ', outputFile);\n          }\n      });\n    } else {\n      console.log(\"Can't find wiki \", fullName, \", is it listed in the Bob settings tab?\");\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This lets you select a wiki html file and split it into individual tiddlers\n    and create a new node wiki for it.\n    It also adds the new wiki to the list of wikis served.\n\n    Rather than mess around with parsing html in node I am going to have this\n    parse the html file into tiddlers in the browser and then send them to this\n    message. This also means that this can be used to make a wiki out of a sub-set of tiddlers from an existing wiki, or from different wikis.\n    TODO make this keep track of where the original wiki is so we can overwrite\n    the original wiki when saving this one.\n\n    inputs:\n    data.filePath - the path to the single file html wiki to split up.\n    data.wikisPath - the path to where the node wiki should be saved.\n    data.wikiFolder - the folder to hold the wikis\n    data.wikiName - the name to give the node version of the wiki\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.newWikiFromTiddlers = function (data) {\n    // Do nothing unless there is an input file path given\n//    if (data.filePath) {\n    if (data.tiddlers) {\n      var path = require('path');\n      var fs = require('fs')\n      var wikiName, wikiTiddlersPath, basePath;\n      var wikiFolder = data.wikiFolder || \"Wikis\";\n      // If there is no wikiname given create one\n      if (data.wikiName) {\n        // If a name is given use it\n        wikiName = GetWikiName(data.wikiName, 0);\n      } else {\n        // Otherwise create a new wikiname\n        wikiName = GetWikiName(\"NewWiki\", 0);\n      }\n      // If there is no output path given use a default one\n      if (data.wikisPath) {\n        basePath = data.wikisPath;\n      } else {\n        basePath = process.pkg?path.dirname(process.argv[0]):process.cwd();\n      }\n\n      // First copy the empty edition to the wikiPath to make the\n      // tiddlywiki.info\n      var params = {\"wiki\": \"\", \"basePath\": basePath, \"wikisFolder\": wikiFolder, \"edition\": \"empty\", \"path\": wikiName, \"wikiName\": wikiName};\n      $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.createNewWiki(params);\n      // Get the folder for the wiki tiddlers\n      wikiTiddlersPath = path.join(basePath, wikiFolder, wikiName, 'tiddlers');\n      // Make sure tiddlers folder exists\n      try {\n        fs.mkdirSync(wikiTiddlersPath);\n        console.log('Created Tiddlers Folder ', wikiTiddlersPath);\n      } catch (e) {\n        console.log('Tiddlers Folder Exists');\n      }\n      // Then split the wiki into separate tidders\n      //var tiddlers = $tw.loadTiddlersFromFile(data.filePath),\n      var count = 0;\n      $tw.utils.each(data.tiddlers,function(tiddler) {\n        // Save each tiddler in the correct folder\n        // Get the tiddler file title\n        var tiddlerFileName = $tw.syncadaptor.generateTiddlerBaseFilepath(tiddler.title);\n        // Output file name\n        var outputFile = path.join(wikiTiddlersPath, tiddlerFileName);\n        var options = {\n          \"currentTiddler\": tiddler.title\n        };\n        var text = $tw.wiki.renderTiddler('text/plain','$:/core/templates/tid-tiddler', options);\n        // Save each tiddler as a file in the appropriate place\n        fs.writeFile(outputFile,text,\"utf8\",function(err) {\n          if (err) {\n            console.log(err);\n          }\n        });\n        count++;\n      });\n      if(!count) {\n        console.log(\"No tiddlers found in the input file\");\n      } else {\n        // Add the new wiki to the list of served wikis\n        // TODO this!!\n      }\n    } else {\n      console.log('No path given!');\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This ensures that the wikiName used is unique by appending a number to the\n    end of the name and incrementing the number if needed until an unused name\n    is created.\n  */\n  function GetWikiName (wikiName, count) {\n    var updatedName;\n    // If the wikiName is usused than return it\n    if (!$tw.settings.wikis[wikiName]) {\n      return wikiName;\n    } else {\n      // Try the next name and recurse\n      if (wikiName.endsWith(count)) {\n        // If the name ends in a number increment it\n        wikiName = wikiName.slice(0, -1*String(count).length);\n        count = Number(count) + 1;\n        updatedName = wikiName + String(count);\n      } else {\n        // If the name doesn't end in a number than add a 1 to start out.\n        count = Number(count) + 1;\n        updatedName = wikiName + String(count);\n      }\n      return GetWikiName(updatedName, count);\n    }\n  }\n\n  // This is just a copy of the init command modified to work in this context\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.createNewWiki = function (data) {\n    if (data.wiki === 'RootWiki') {\n      var fs = require(\"fs\"),\n        path = require(\"path\");\n\n      function specialCopy (source, destination) {\n        fs.mkdirSync(destination);\n        var currentDir = fs.readdirSync(source)\n        currentDir.forEach(function (item) {\n          if (fs.statSync(path.join(source, item)).isFile()) {\n            var fd = fs.readFileSync(path.join(source, item), {encoding: 'utf8'});\n            fs.writeFileSync(path.join(destination, item), fd, {encoding: 'utf8'});\n          } else {\n            //Recurse!! Because it is a folder.\n            // But make sure it is a directory first.\n            if (fs.statSync(path.join(source, item)).isDirectory()) {\n              specialCopy(path.join(source, item), path.join(destination, item));\n            }\n          }\n        });\n      }\n\n      // Paths are relative to the root wiki path\n      if (process.pkg) {\n        // This is for handling when it is a single executable\n        // Base path is where the executable is by default\n        data.basePath = data.basePath || path.dirname(process.argv[0]);\n        data.wikisFolder = data.wikisFolder || 'Wikis';\n      }\n      data.wikisFolder = data.wikisFolder || '';\n      // If no basepath is given than the default is to make the folder a\n      // sibling of the index wiki folder\n      var basePath = data.basePath || path.join($tw.boot.wikiPath, '..')\n\n      try {\n        fs.mkdirSync(path.join(basePath, data.wikisFolder));\n        console.log('Created Wikis Folder');\n      } catch (e) {\n        console.log('Wikis Folder Exists');\n      }\n      // This is the path given by the person making the wiki, it needs to be\n      // relative to the basePath\n      // data.wikisFolder is an optional sub-folder to use. If it is set to\n      // Wikis than wikis created will be in the basepath/Wikis/relativePath\n      // folder\n      // I need better names here.\n      var relativePath = path.join(data.wikisFolder, data.path);\n      var fullPath = path.join(basePath, relativePath)\n      var tiddlersPath = path.join(fullPath, 'tiddlers')\n      // For now we only support creating wikis with one edition, multi edition\n      // things like in the normal init command can come later.\n      var editionName = data.edition?data.edition:\"empty\";\n      var searchPaths = $tw.getLibraryItemSearchPaths($tw.config.editionsPath,$tw.config.editionsEnvVar);\n      if (process.pkg) {\n        var editionPath = $tw.findLibraryItem(editionName,searchPaths);\n        if(!$tw.utils.isDirectory(editionPath)) {\n          //var editionPath = undefined\n          editionPath = undefined\n          var pluginPath = process.pkg.path.resolve(\"./editions\",\"./\" + editionName)\n          if(true || fs.existsSync(pluginPath) && fs.statSync(pluginPath).isDirectory()) {\n            editionPath = pluginPath;\n          }\n          if (editionPath) {\n            specialCopy(editionPath, fullPath);\n            console.log(\"Copied edition '\" + editionName + \"' to \" + fullPath + \"\\n\");\n          } else {\n            console.log(\"Edition not found\");\n          }\n        } else if ($tw.utils.isDirectory(editionPath)) {\n          // Copy the edition content\n          var err = $tw.utils.copyDirectory(editionPath,fullPath);\n          if(!err) {\n            console.log(\"Copied edition '\" + editionName + \"' to \" + fullPath + \"\\n\");\n          } else {\n            console.log(err);\n          }\n        }\n      } else {\n        // Check the edition exists\n        var editionPath = $tw.findLibraryItem(editionName,searchPaths);\n        if(!$tw.utils.isDirectory(editionPath)) {\n          console.log(\"Edition '\" + editionName + \"' not found\");\n        }\n        // Copy the edition content\n        var err = $tw.utils.copyDirectory(editionPath,fullPath);\n        if(!err) {\n          console.log(\"Copied edition '\" + editionName + \"' to \" + fullPath + \"\\n\");\n        } else {\n          console.log(err);\n        }\n      }\n      // Tweak the tiddlywiki.info to remove any included wikis\n      var packagePath = path.join(fullPath, \"tiddlywiki.info\");\n      var packageJson = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(packagePath));\n      delete packageJson.includeWikis;\n      fs.writeFileSync(packagePath,JSON.stringify(packageJson,null,$tw.config.preferences.jsonSpaces));\n\n      // We need to make sure that the wikis entry is in the root settings\n      // thing.\n      var tidText = {};\n      var tiddler = $tw.wiki.getTiddler('{RootWiki}$:/WikiSettings/split');\n      if (tiddler) {\n        if (typeof tiddler.fields.text === 'object') {\n          // Clone object to make it writable\n          tidText = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(tiddler.fields.text));\n        } else {\n          tidText = JSON.parse(tiddler.fields.text);\n        }\n      }\n      tidText['wikis'] = tidText['wikis'] || '$:/WikiSettings/split/wikis';\n\n      $tw.wiki.addTiddler(new $tw.Tiddler({title:'{RootWiki}$:/WikiSettings/split', text:tidText, type: 'application/json'}));\n      $tw.Bob.SendToBrowsers({type: 'saveTiddler', tiddler: {fields: {title:'$:/WikiSettings/split', text:JSON.stringify(tidText, \"\", $tw.config.preferences.jsonSpaces), type: 'application/json'}}, wiki: 'RootWiki'});\n\n      var tiddlerText = $tw.wiki.getTiddlerText('{RootWiki}$:/WikiSettings/split/wikis')\n\n      tiddlerText = tiddlerText?tiddlerText:\"{}\";\n      var currentWikis = JSON.parse(tiddlerText);\n      // Get desired name for the new wiki\n      var name = data.wikiName || 'newWiki';\n      // Make sure we have a unique name by appending a number to the wiki name\n      // if it exists.\n      if (currentWikis[name]) {\n        var i = 0;\n        var newName = name;\n        while (currentWikis[newName]) {\n          i = i + 1;\n          newName = name + i;\n        }\n        name = name + i;\n      }\n\n      // Use relative paths here.\n      // Note this that is dependent on process.cwd()!!\n      var rootPath = process.pkg?path.dirname(process.argv[0]):process.cwd();\n      currentWikis[name] = '.' + path.sep + path.relative(rootPath, fullPath);\n\n      var tiddlerFields = {\n        title: '{RootWiki}$:/WikiSettings/split/wikis',\n        text: JSON.stringify(currentWikis, null, $tw.config.preferences.jsonSpaces),\n        type: 'application/json'\n      };\n      // Add the tiddler\n      $tw.wiki.addTiddler(new $tw.Tiddler(tiddlerFields));\n      // Push changes out to the browsers\n      var tiddlerFields2 = {\n        title: '$:/WikiSettings/split/wikis',\n        text: JSON.stringify(currentWikis, null, $tw.config.preferences.jsonSpaces),\n        type: 'application/json'\n      };\n      $tw.Bob.SendToBrowsers({type: 'saveTiddler', tiddler: {fields: tiddlerFields2}, wiki: 'RootWiki'});\n\n      $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.saveSettings({wiki: 'RootWiki'});\n\n      // This is here as a hook for an external server. It is defined by the\n      // external server and shouldn't be defined here or it will break\n      // If you are not using an external server than this does nothing\n      if ($tw.ExternalServer) {\n        if (typeof $tw.ExternalServer.initialiseWikiSettings === 'function') {\n          $tw.ExternalServer.initialiseWikiSettings(name, data);\n        }\n      }\n\n      // Then clear all the routes to the non-root wiki\n      $tw.httpServer.clearRoutes();\n      // The re-add all the routes from the settings\n      // This reads the settings so we don't need to give it any arguments\n      $tw.httpServer.addOtherRoutes();\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This unloads a wiki from memory.\n    This can be used to reduce the memory footprint and to fully reload a wiki.\n\n    It needs to remove everything under $tw.Bob.Wikis[data.wikiName] for the\n    wiki. And it also need to find all of the tiddlers for the wiki and remove\n    them. But I don't know how to do that without deleting the tiddlers.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.unloadWiki = function (data) {\n    console.log('Unload wiki ', data.wikiName)\n    // make sure that there is a wiki name given.\n    if (data.wikiName) {\n      // Make sure that the wiki is loaded\n      if ($tw.Bob.Wikis[data.wikiName]) {\n        if ($tw.Bob.Wikis[data.wikiName].State === 'loaded') {\n          // If so than unload the wiki\n          // Get the list of tiddlers for this wiki\n          $tw.wiki.allTitles().filter(function(title) {\n            return title.startsWith('{' + data.wikiName + '}');\n          }).forEach(function(title) {\n            // Remove all the tiddlers listed as being in the wiki from\n            // the internal listing.\n            $tw.wiki.deleteTiddler(title);\n          })\n          // This removes the information about the wiki\n          delete $tw.Bob.Wikis[data.wikiName];\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n    Determine if the token is authorised to view the wiki\n  */\n  function canAccess(token, wiki) {\n    return true\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This message fetches tiddlers from another wiki on the same Bob server\n    The input data object has:\n      fromWiki - the name of the wiki to pull from\n      filter - the tiddler filter to use to select tiddlers from the remote\n        wiki\n      transformFilter - the titles of imported tiddlers are modified by this\n        filter.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.internalFetch = function(data) {\n    // Make sure that the person has access to the wiki\n    var authorised = canAccess(data.token, data.fromWiki)\n    if (authorised) {\n      // Make sure that the wiki is listed\n      if ($tw.settings.wikis[data.fromWiki]) {\n        // If the wiki isn't loaded than load it\n        if (!$tw.Bob.Wikis[data.fromWiki]) {\n          $tw.ServerSide.loadWiki(data.fromWiki, $tw.settings.wikis[data.fromWiki]);\n        } else if ($tw.Bob.Wikis[data.fromWiki].State !== 'loaded') {\n          $tw.ServerSide.loadWiki(data.fromWiki, $tw.settings.wikis[data.fromWiki]);\n        }\n        // Make sure that the wiki exists and is loaded\n        if ($tw.Bob.Wikis[data.fromWiki]) {\n          if ($tw.Bob.Wikis[data.fromWiki].State === 'loaded') {\n            // Make a temp wiki to run the filter on\n            var tempWiki = new $tw.Wiki();\n            $tw.Bob.Wikis[data.fromWiki].tiddlers.forEach(function(internalTitle) {\n              var tiddler = $tw.wiki.getTiddler(internalTitle);\n              var newTiddler = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(tiddler));\n              newTiddler.fields.modified = $tw.utils.stringifyDate(new Date(newTiddler.fields.modified));\n              newTiddler.fields.created = $tw.utils.stringifyDate(new Date(newTiddler.fields.created));\n              newTiddler.fields.title = newTiddler.fields.title.replace('{' + data.fromWiki + '}', '');\n              // Add all the tiddlers that belong in wiki\n              tempWiki.addTiddler(new $tw.Tiddler(newTiddler.fields));\n            })\n            // Use the filter\n            var list = tempWiki.filterTiddlers(data.filter);\n            // Add the results to the current wiki\n            // Each tiddler gets added to the requesting wiki\n            list.forEach(function(tidTitle){\n              var tiddler = tempWiki.getTiddler(tidTitle);\n              if (data.transformFilter) {\n                var transformedTitle = (tempWiki.filterTiddlers(data.transformFilter, null, tempWiki.makeTiddlerIterator([tidTitle])) || [\"\"])[0];\n                if(transformedTitle) {\n                  tiddler = new $tw.Tiddler(tiddler,{title: transformedTitle});\n                }\n              }\n              var message = {type: 'conflict', message: 'saveTiddler', tiddler: tiddler};\n              $tw.Bob.SendToBrowser($tw.connections[data.source_connection], message)\n            })\n          }\n        }\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This handles ack messages.\n  */\n  $tw.nodeMessageHandlers.ack = $tw.Bob.Shared.handleAck;\n\n}\n})()\n",
            "type": "application/javascript",
            "module-type": "startup"
        },
        "$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/NodeWebSocketsSetup.js": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/NodeWebSocketsSetup.js",
            "text": "/*\\\ntitle: $:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/NodeWebSocketsSetup.js\ntype: application/javascript\nmodule-type: startup\n\nThis is the node component of the web sockets. It works with\nweb-sockets-setup.js and ActionWebSocketMessage.js which set up the browser\nside and make the action widget used to send messages to the node process.\n\nTo extend this you make a new file that adds functions to the\n$tw.nodeMessageHandlers object.\n\n\\*/\n(function(){\n\n/*jslint node: true, browser: true */\n/*global $tw: false */\n\"use strict\";\n\nexports.name = \"websocket-server\";\nexports.platforms = [\"node\"];\nexports.after = [\"node-settings\"];\nexports.synchronous = true;\n\n// require the websockets module if we are running node\nvar WebSocketServer = $tw.node ? require('$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/External/WS/ws.js').Server : undefined;\nvar fs = $tw.node ? require(\"fs\"): undefined;\nvar http = $tw.node ? require(\"http\") : undefined;\nvar path = $tw.node ? require(\"path\") : undefined;\n//  var TOML = $tw.node ? require('$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/External/@iarna/toml/toml.js') : undefined;\n\nif ($tw.node) {\n  // Import shared commands\n  $tw.Bob.Shared = require('$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/SharedFunctions.js');\n  /*\n    This sets up the websocket server and attaches it to the $tw object\n  */\n  var setup = function () {\n    // initialise the empty $tw.nodeMessageHandlers object. This holds the functions that\n    // are used for each message type\n    $tw.nodeMessageHandlers = $tw.nodeMessageHandlers || {};\n    $tw.Bob = $tw.Bob || {};\n    $tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers = $tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers || {};\n    $tw.Bob.MessageQueue = $tw.Bob.MessageQueue || [];\n    // Initialise connections array\n    $tw.connections = $tw.connections || [];\n\n    if (!$tw.settings) {\n      // Make sure that $tw.settings is available.\n      var settings = require('$:/plugins/OokTech/NodeSettings/NodeSettings.js')\n    }\n    // Get the ip address to display to make it easier for other computers to\n    // connect.\n    var ip = require('$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/External/IP/ip.js');\n    var ipAddress = ip.address();\n\n    $tw.settings['ws-server'] = $tw.settings['ws-server'] || {};\n    var ServerPort = Number($tw.settings['ws-server'].port) || 8080;\n    var host = $tw.settings['ws-server'].host || '127.0.0.1';\n\n    /*\n      Make the tiddler that lists the available wikis and puts it in a data tiddler\n    */\n    var MakeWikiListTiddler = function () {\n      var tiddlerFields = {\n        title: '$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/WikiList',\n        text: JSON.stringify($tw.settings.wikis, \"\", 2),\n        type: 'application/json'\n      };\n      $tw.wiki.addTiddler(new $tw.Tiddler(tiddlerFields));\n    }\n\n    MakeWikiListTiddler();\n\n    /*\n      This function ensures that the WS server is made on an available port\n    */\n    var server;\n    /*\n      Setup the websocket server if we aren't using an external one\n    */\n    function finishSetup () {\n      if (!$tw.settings['ws-server'].useExternalWSS) {\n        //$tw.wss = new WebSocketServer({server: server});\n        $tw.wss = new WebSocketServer({noServer: true});\n        // Set the onconnection function\n        $tw.wss.on('connection', handleConnection);\n        // I don't know how to set up actually closing a connection, so this doesn't\n        // do anything useful yet\n        $tw.wss.on('close', function(connection) {\n          console.log('closed connection ', connection);\n        });\n      }\n\n      $tw.settings.serverInfo = {\n        ipAddress: ipAddress,\n        port: ServerPort,\n        host: host\n      };\n    }\n\n    finishSetup();\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This function handles connections to a client.\n    It currently only supports one client and if a new client connection is made\n    it will replace the current connection.\n    This function saves the connection and adds the message handler wrapper to\n    the client connection.\n    The message handler part is a generic wrapper that checks to see if we have a\n    handler function for the message type and if so it passes the message to the\n    handler, if not it prints an error to the console.\n\n    connection objects are:\n    {\n      \"socket\": socketObject,\n      \"wiki\": the name for the wiki using this connection\n    }\n  */\n  function handleConnection(client, request) {\n    console.log(\"new connection\");\n    $tw.connections.push({'socket':client, 'wiki': undefined});\n    client.on('message', $tw.Bob.handleMessage);\n    // Respond to the initial connection with a request for the tiddlers the\n    // browser currently has to initialise everything.\n    $tw.connections[Object.keys($tw.connections).length-1].index = Object.keys($tw.connections).length-1;\n    var message = {type: 'listTiddlers'}\n    $tw.Bob.SendToBrowser($tw.connections[Object.keys($tw.connections).length-1], message);\n  }\n\n  /*\n    A placeholder, I may put something here later\n  */\n  function authenticateMessage(event) {\n    return true\n  }\n\n  /*\n    The handle message function, split out so we can use it other places\n  */\n  $tw.Bob.handleMessage = function(event) {\n    var self = this;\n    // Determine which connection the message came from\n    var thisIndex = $tw.connections.findIndex(function(connection) {return connection.socket === self;});\n    try {\n      var eventData = JSON.parse(event);\n      // Add the source to the eventData object so it can be used later.\n      eventData.source_connection = thisIndex;\n      // If the wiki on this connection hasn't been determined yet, take it\n      // from the first message that lists the wiki.\n      // After that the wiki can't be changed. It isn't a good security\n      // measure but this part doesn't have real security anyway.\n      // TODO figure out if this is actually a security problem.\n      // We may have to add a check to the token before sending outgoing\n      // messages.\n      // This is really only a concern for the secure server, in that case\n      // you authenticate the token and it only works if the wiki matches\n      // and the token has access to that wiki.\n      if (eventData.wiki && eventData.wiki !== $tw.connections[thisIndex].wiki && !$tw.connections[thisIndex].wiki) {\n        $tw.connections[thisIndex].wiki = eventData.wiki;\n        // Make sure that the new connection has the correct list of tiddlers\n        // being edited.\n        $tw.Bob.UpdateEditingTiddlers();\n      }\n      // Make sure we have a handler for the message type\n      if (typeof $tw.nodeMessageHandlers[eventData.type] === 'function') {\n        // Check authorisation\n        var authorised = authenticateMessage(eventData)\n        if (authorised) {\n          eventData.decoded = authorised\n          $tw.nodeMessageHandlers[eventData.type](eventData);\n        }\n      } else {\n        console.log('No handler for message of type ', eventData.type);\n      }\n    } catch (e) {\n      console.log(\"WebSocket error, probably closed connection: \", e);\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This updates the list of tiddlers being edited in each wiki. Any tiddler on\n    this list has the edit button disabled to prevent two people from\n    simultaneously editing the same tiddler.\n    If run without an input it just re-sends the lists to each browser, with a\n    tiddler title as input it appends that tiddler to the list and sends the\n    updated list to all connected browsers.\n\n    For privacy and security only the tiddlers that are in the wiki a\n    conneciton is using are sent to that connection.\n  */\n  $tw.Bob.UpdateEditingTiddlers = function (tiddler) {\n    // Check if a tiddler title was passed as input and that the tiddler isn't\n    // already listed as being edited.\n    // If there is a title and it isn't being edited add it to the list.\n    if (tiddler && !$tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers[tiddler]) {\n      $tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers[tiddler] = true;\n    }\n    Object.keys($tw.connections).forEach(function(index) {\n      var list = Object.keys($tw.Bob.EditingTiddlers).filter(function(title) {\n        return title.startsWith('{' + $tw.connections[index].wiki + '}');\n      });\n      var message = {type: 'updateEditingTiddlers', list: list, wiki: $tw.connections[index].wiki};\n      $tw.Bob.SendToBrowser($tw.connections[index], message);\n    });\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This is a wrapper function that takes a message that is meant to be sent to\n    all connected browsers and handles the details.\n\n    It iterates though all connections, checkis if each one is active, tries to\n    send the message, if the sending fails than it sets the connection as\n    inactive.\n\n    Note: This checks if the message is a string despite SendToBrowser also\n    checking because if it needs to be changed and sent to multiple browsers\n    changing it once here instead of once per browser should be better.\n  */\n  $tw.Bob.SendToBrowsers = function (message) {\n    $tw.Bob.UpdateHistory(message);\n    var messageData = $tw.Bob.Shared.createMessageData(message);\n    // Send message to all connections.\n    $tw.connections.forEach(function (connection) {\n      if (connection.socket.readyState === 1 && (connection.wiki === messageData.message.wiki || !messageData.message.wiki)) {\n        $tw.Bob.Shared.sendMessage(messageData, connection.index);\n      }\n    })\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This function sends a message to a single connected browser. It takes the\n    browser connection object and the stringifyed message as input.\n    If any attempt fails mark the connection as inacive.\n\n    On the server side the history is a bit more complex.\n    There is one history of messages sent that has the message ids, each\n    connection has a list of message ids that are still waiting for acks.\n  */\n  $tw.Bob.SendToBrowser = function (connection, message) {\n    $tw.Bob.UpdateHistory(message);\n    var messageData = $tw.Bob.Shared.createMessageData(message);\n    // If the connection is open, send the message\n    if (connection.socket.readyState === 1 && (connection.wiki === messageData.message.wiki || !messageData.message.wiki)) {\n      $tw.Bob.Shared.sendMessage(messageData, connection.index);\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n    This keeps a history of changes for each wiki so that when a wiki is\n    disconnected and reconnects and asks to resync this can be used to resync\n    the wiki with the minimum amount of network traffic.\n\n    Resyncing only needs to keep track of creating and deleting tiddlers here.\n    The editing state of tiddlers is taken care of by the websocket\n    reconnection process.\n\n    So this is just the list of deleted tiddlers and saved tiddlers with time\n    stamps, and it should at most have one item per tiddler because the newest\n    save or delete message overrides any previous messages.\n\n    The hisotry is an array of change entries\n    Each entry in the history is in the form\n    {\n      title: tiddlerTitle,\n      timestamp: changeTimeStamp,\n      type: messageType\n    }\n  */\n  $tw.Bob.UpdateHistory = function(message) {\n    // Only save saveTiddler or deleteTiddler events that have a wiki listed\n    if (['saveTiddler', 'deleteTiddler'].indexOf(message.type) !== -1 && message.wiki) {\n      $tw.Bob.ServerHistory = $tw.Bob.ServerHistory || {};\n      $tw.Bob.ServerHistory[message.wiki] = $tw.Bob.ServerHistory[message.wiki] || [];\n      var entryIndex = $tw.Bob.ServerHistory[message.wiki].findIndex(function(entry) {\n        return entry.title === message.tiddler.fields.title;\n      })\n      var entry = {\n        timestamp: Date.now(),\n        title: message.tiddler.fields.title,\n        type: message.type\n      }\n      if (entryIndex > -1) {\n        $tw.Bob.ServerHistory[message.wiki][entryIndex] = entry;\n      } else {\n        $tw.Bob.ServerHistory[message.wiki].push(entry);\n      }\n    }\n  }\n\n  // Only act if we are running on node. Otherwise WebSocketServer will be\n  // undefined.\n  setup();\n}\n\n})();\n",
            "type": "application/javascript",
            "module-type": "startup"
        },
        "$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/WebsocketAdaptor.js": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/WebsocketAdaptor.js",
            "text": "/*\\\ntitle: $:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/WebsocketAdaptor.js\ntype: application/javascript\nmodule-type: syncadaptor\n\nA sync adaptor module for synchronising using Websockets\n\n\\*/\n(function(){\n\n/*jslint node: true, browser: true */\n/*global $tw: false */\n\"use strict\";\n\nexports.platforms = [\"node\"];\n\n// Get a reference to the file system\nvar fs = $tw.node ? require(\"fs\") : null,\n  path = $tw.node ? require(\"path\") : null;\n\nif($tw.node) {\n\n  function WebsocketAdaptor(options) {\n    var self = this;\n    this.wiki = options.wiki;\n    this.logger = new $tw.utils.Logger(\"WebsocketAdaptor\",{colour: \"blue\"});\n    // Create the <wiki>/tiddlers folder if it doesn't exist\n    //$tw.utils.createDirectory($tw.boot.wikiTiddlersPath);\n  }\n\n  WebsocketAdaptor.prototype.name = \"WebsocketAdaptor\";\n\n  WebsocketAdaptor.prototype.isReady = function() {\n    // The file system adaptor is always ready\n    return true;\n  };\n\n  WebsocketAdaptor.prototype.getTiddlerInfo = function(tiddler) {\n    return {};\n  };\n\n  /*\n  Return a fileInfo object for a tiddler, creating it if necessary:\n    filepath: the absolute path to the file containing the tiddler\n    type: the type of the tiddler file (NOT the type of the tiddler -- see below)\n    hasMetaFile: true if the file also has a companion .meta file\n\n  The boot process populates $tw.boot.files for each of the tiddler files that it loads. The type is found by looking up the extension in $tw.config.fileExtensionInfo (eg \"application/x-tiddler\" for \".tid\" files).\n\n  It is the responsibility of the filesystem adaptor to update $tw.boot.files for new files that are created.\n  */\n  WebsocketAdaptor.prototype.getTiddlerFileInfo = function(tiddler, prefix, callback) {\n    prefix = prefix || '';\n    if (!callback) {\n      callback = function (err, fileInfo) {\n        if (err) {\n          console.log(err);\n        } else {\n          return fileInfo;\n        }\n      }\n    }\n    // See if we've already got information about this file\n    var self = this,\n      title = tiddler.fields.title;\n    if (title.startsWith('{' + prefix + '}')) {\n      title = title.replace('{' + prefix + '}', '');\n    }\n    var internalTitle = '{' + prefix + '}' + title;\n    var fileInfo = $tw.boot.files[internalTitle];\n    if(fileInfo) {\n      // If so, just invoke the callback\n      callback(null,fileInfo);\n    } else {\n      // Otherwise, we'll need to generate it\n      fileInfo = {};\n      var tiddlerType = tiddler.fields.type || \"text/vnd.tiddlywiki\";\n      // Get the content type info\n      var contentTypeInfo = $tw.config.contentTypeInfo[tiddlerType] || {};\n      // Get the file type by looking up the extension\n      var extension = contentTypeInfo.extension || \".tid\";\n      fileInfo.type = ($tw.config.fileExtensionInfo[extension] || {type: \"application/x-tiddler\"}).type;\n      // Use a .meta file unless we're saving a .tid file.\n      // (We would need more complex logic if we supported other template rendered tiddlers besides .tid)\n      fileInfo.hasMetaFile = (fileInfo.type !== \"application/x-tiddler\") && (fileInfo.type !== \"application/json\");\n      if(!fileInfo.hasMetaFile) {\n        extension = \".tid\";\n      }\n      // Generate the base filepath and ensure the directories exist\n      $tw.Bob.Wikis = $tw.Bob.Wikis || {};\n      $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix] = $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix] || {};\n      // A cludge to make things work\n      if (prefix === 'RootWiki') {\n        $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].wikiTiddlersPath = $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].wikiTiddlersPath || $tw.boot.wikiTiddlersPath;\n      }\n      var tiddlersPath = $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].wikiTiddlersPath;\n      var baseFilepath = path.resolve(tiddlersPath, self.generateTiddlerBaseFilepath(title));\n      $tw.utils.createFileDirectories(baseFilepath);\n      // Start by getting a list of the existing files in the directory\n      fs.readdir(path.dirname(baseFilepath),function(err,files) {\n        if(err) {\n          return callback(err);\n        }\n        // Start with the base filename plus the extension\n        var filepath = baseFilepath;\n        if(filepath.substr(-extension.length).toLocaleLowerCase() !== extension.toLocaleLowerCase()) {\n          filepath = filepath + extension;\n        }\n        var filename = path.basename(filepath),\n          count = 1;\n        // Add a discriminator if we're clashing with an existing filename while\n        // handling case-insensitive filesystems (NTFS, FAT/FAT32, etc.)\n        while(files.some(function(value) {return value.toLocaleLowerCase() === filename.toLocaleLowerCase();})) {\n          filepath = baseFilepath + \" \" + (count++) + extension;\n          filename = path.basename(filepath);\n        }\n        // Set the final fileInfo\n        fileInfo.filepath = filepath;\n  console.log(\"\\x1b[1;35m\" + \"For \" + title + \", type is \" + fileInfo.type + \" hasMetaFile is \" + fileInfo.hasMetaFile + \" filepath is \" + fileInfo.filepath + \"\\x1b[0m\");\n        $tw.boot.files[internalTitle] = fileInfo;\n        $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].tiddlers = $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].tiddlers || [];\n        if ($tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].tiddlers.indexOf(internalTitle) !== -1) {\n          $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].tiddlers.push(internalTitle);\n        }\n        // Pass it to the callback\n        callback(null,fileInfo);\n      });\n    }\n  };\n\n  /*\n  Given a list of filters, apply every one in turn to source, and return the first result of the first filter with non-empty result.\n  */\n  WebsocketAdaptor.prototype.findFirstFilter = function(filters,source) {\n    for(var i=0; i<filters.length; i++) {\n      var result = this.wiki.filterTiddlers(filters[i],null,source);\n      if(result.length > 0) {\n        return result[0];\n      }\n    }\n    return null;\n  };\n\n  /*\n  Given a tiddler title and an array of existing filenames, generate a new legal filename for the title, case insensitively avoiding the array of existing filenames\n  */\n  WebsocketAdaptor.prototype.generateTiddlerBaseFilepath = function(title) {\n    if (title.startsWith('{')) {\n      var ending = title.indexOf('}');\n      // If ending is -1 than this just returns the title, otherwise it cuts\n      // off the prefix.\n      title = title.slice(ending+1)\n    }\n    var baseFilename;\n    // Check whether the user has configured a tiddler -> pathname mapping\n    var pathNameFilters = this.wiki.getTiddlerText(\"$:/config/FileSystemPaths\");\n    if(pathNameFilters) {\n      var source = this.wiki.makeTiddlerIterator([title]);\n      baseFilename = this.findFirstFilter(pathNameFilters.split(\"\\n\"),source);\n      if(baseFilename) {\n        // Interpret \"/\" and \"\\\" as path separator\n        baseFilename = baseFilename.replace(/\\/|\\\\/g,path.sep);\n      }\n    }\n    if(!baseFilename) {\n      // No mappings provided, or failed to match this tiddler so we use title as filename\n      baseFilename = title.replace(/\\/|\\\\/g,\"_\");\n    }\n    // Remove any of the characters that are illegal in Windows filenames\n    var baseFilename = $tw.utils.transliterate(baseFilename.replace(/<|>|\\:|\\\"|\\||\\?|\\*|\\^/g,\"_\"));\n    // Truncate the filename if it is too long\n    if(baseFilename.length > 200) {\n      baseFilename = baseFilename.substr(0,200);\n    }\n    return baseFilename;\n  };\n\n  /*\n  Save a tiddler and invoke the callback with (err,adaptorInfo,revision)\n  */\n  WebsocketAdaptor.prototype.saveTiddler = function(tiddler, prefix, callback) {\n    if (typeof prefix === 'function') {\n      callback = prefix;\n      prefix = '';\n    }\n    if (typeof callback !== 'function') {\n      callback = function () {\n\n      }\n    }\n    prefix = prefix || 'RootWiki';\n    var internalName = (prefix === '' || tiddler.fields.title.startsWith('{' + prefix + '}')) ? tiddler.fields.title:'{' + prefix + '}' + tiddler.fields.title;\n    if (tiddler && $tw.Bob.ExcludeList.indexOf(tiddler.fields.title) === -1 && !tiddler.fields.title.startsWith('$:/state/') && !tiddler.fields.title.startsWith('$:/temp/')) {\n      var self = this;\n      self.getTiddlerFileInfo(tiddler, prefix,\n       function(err,fileInfo) {\n        if(err) {\n          return callback(err);\n        }\n        var filepath = fileInfo.filepath,\n          error = $tw.utils.createDirectory(path.dirname(filepath));\n        if(error) {\n          return callback(error);\n        }\n        // Save the tiddler in memory.\n        internalSave(tiddler, internalName, prefix);\n        // Handle saving to the file system\n        if(fileInfo.hasMetaFile) {\n          var title = tiddler.fields.title.startsWith('{' + prefix + '}')?title:'{'+prefix+'}'+tiddler.fields.title\n          // Save the tiddler as a separate body and meta file\n          var typeInfo = $tw.config.contentTypeInfo[tiddler.fields.type || \"text/plain\"] || {encoding: \"utf8\"};\n          var content = $tw.wiki.renderTiddler(\"text/plain\", \"$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/templates/tiddler-metadata\", {variables: {currentTiddler: title}});\n          fs.writeFile(fileInfo.filepath + \".meta\",content,{encoding: \"utf8\"},function (err) {\n            if(err) {\n              return callback(err);\n            }\n            // TODO figure out why this gets stuck in an infinite saving loop\n            // from connected browsers when renaming if this part isn't done\n            // always\n            // It is because the internalSave keeps waiting for a response about\n            // the non-.meta file and it dosen't exist. I don't have a fix for\n            // it yet.\n            if (tiddler.fields.text && tiddler.fields.text !== '' || true) {\n              // TODO figure out why renaming inside the wiki isn't working here\n              fs.writeFile(filepath,tiddler.fields.text,{encoding: typeInfo.encoding},function(err) {\n                if(err) {\n                  return callback(err);\n                }\n                // Save with metadata\n                console.log('saved file with metadata', filepath);\n                return callback(null);\n              });\n            } else {\n              console.log('saved file with metadata', filepath)\n              return callback(null);\n            }\n          });\n        } else {\n          var title = tiddler.fields.title.startsWith('{' + prefix + '}')?title:'{'+prefix+'}'+tiddler.fields.title;\n          // Save the tiddler as a self contained templated file\n          var content = $tw.wiki.renderTiddler(\"text/plain\", \"$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/templates/tid-tiddler\", {variables: {currentTiddler: title}});\n          // If we aren't passed a path\n          fs.writeFile(filepath,content,{encoding: \"utf8\"},function (err) {\n            if(err) {\n              return callback(err);\n            }\n            console.log('saved file', filepath)\n            return callback(null);\n          });\n        }\n      });\n    }\n  };\n\n  // After the tiddler file is saved this takes care of the internal part\n  function internalSave (tiddler, internalName, prefix) {\n    // addTiddler needs the prefixed title!!\n    var tempTiddlerFields = {};\n    Object.keys(tiddler.fields).forEach(function(fieldName) {\n      tempTiddlerFields[fieldName] = tiddler.fields[fieldName];\n    });\n    tempTiddlerFields.title = internalName;\n    $tw.wiki.addTiddler(new $tw.Tiddler(tempTiddlerFields));\n    var message = {type: 'saveTiddler', wiki: prefix, tiddler: {fields: tiddler.fields}};\n    $tw.Bob.SendToBrowsers(message);\n    // This may help\n    $tw.Bob.Wikis = $tw.Bob.Wikis || {};\n    $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix] = $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix] || {};\n    $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].tiddlers = $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].tiddlers || [];\n    if ($tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].tiddlers.indexOf(internalName) === -1) {\n      $tw.Bob.Wikis[prefix].tiddlers.push(internalName);\n    }\n  }\n\n  /*\n  Load a tiddler and invoke the callback with (err,tiddlerFields)\n\n  We don't need to implement loading for the file system adaptor, because all the tiddler files will have been loaded during the boot process.\n  */\n  WebsocketAdaptor.prototype.loadTiddler = function(title,callback) {\n    if (!callback) {\n      callback = function () {\n\n      }\n    }\n    callback(null,null);\n  };\n\n  /*\n  Delete a tiddler and invoke the callback with (err)\n  */\n  WebsocketAdaptor.prototype.deleteTiddler = function(title, callback, options) {\n    if (!callback) {\n      callback = function () {\n        // Just a blank function to prevent errors\n      }\n    }\n    var self = this,\n      fileInfo = $tw.boot.files[title];\n    // Only delete the tiddler if we have writable information for the file\n    if(fileInfo) {\n      //console.log('Delete tiddler file ', fileInfo.filepath);\n      // Delete the file\n      fs.unlink(fileInfo.filepath,function(err) {\n        if(err) {\n          return callback(err);\n        }\n        // Delete the tiddler from the internal tiddlywiki side of things\n        delete $tw.boot.files[title];\n        $tw.wiki.deleteTiddler(title);\n        // Create a message saying to remove the tiddler\n        // get the prefix\n        var prefix = title.slice(1,title.indexOf('}'));\n        // Remove the prefix from the tiddler\n        var tiddlerName = title.replace(new RegExp('^\\{' + prefix + '\\}'),'');\n        var message = {type: 'deleteTiddler', tiddler: {fields:{title: tiddlerName}}, wiki: prefix};\n        // Send the message to each connected browser\n        $tw.Bob.SendToBrowsers(message);\n        //self.logger.log(\"Deleted file\",fileInfo.filepath);\n        // Delete the metafile if present\n        if(fileInfo.hasMetaFile) {\n          fs.unlink(fileInfo.filepath + \".meta\",function(err) {\n            if(err) {\n              return callback(err);\n            }\n            return $tw.utils.deleteEmptyDirs(path.dirname(fileInfo.filepath),callback);\n          });\n        } else {\n          return $tw.utils.deleteEmptyDirs(path.dirname(fileInfo.filepath),callback);\n        }\n      });\n    } else {\n      callback(null);\n    }\n  };\n\n  exports.adaptorClass = WebsocketAdaptor;\n}\n\n})();\n",
            "type": "application/javascript",
            "module-type": "syncadaptor"
        },
        "$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/Wiki Listing": {
            "title": "$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/Wiki Listing",
            "caption": "Wiki Listing",
            "text": "\\define thisMakeURL() ./$(PathPrefix)$$(WikiName)$\n\n\\define thisMakeWikiListing()\n<$list\n  filter='[<currentLevel>indexes[]]'\n  variable='WikiName'\n  emptyMessage='No child wikis listed.'\n>\n  <$list\n    filter='[<currentLevel>getindex<WikiName>!prefix<currentLevel>]'\n    variable='Path'\n  >\n    <li>\n      <a href=<<thisMakeURL>> target='_blank'><$text text=<<PathPrefix>>/><$text text=<<WikiName>>/></a>\n    </li>\n  </$list>\n  <$list\n    filter='[<currentLevel>getindex<WikiName>prefix<currentLevel>]'\n    variable=currentLevel\n  >\n    <$set\n      name=PathPrefix\n      filter='[<PathPrefix>addsuffix<WikiName>addsuffix[/]]'\n    >\n      <<thisMakeWikiListing>>\n    </$set>\n  </$list>\n</$list>\n\\end\n\nAvailable Wikis:\n\n<ul>\n  <$vars\n    currentLevel='$:/WikiSettings/split/wikis'\n    PathPrefix={{$:/ServerIP!!path_prefix}}\n  >\n    <<thisMakeWikiListing>>\n  </$vars>\n</ul>\n"

            "title": "$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/commands/externalserver.js",
            "text": "/*\\\ntitle: $:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/commands/externalserver.js\ntype: application/javascript\nmodule-type: command\n\nServe tiddlers using a two-way websocket server over http\n\n\\*/\n(function(){\n\n/*jslint node: true, browser: true */\n/*global $tw: false */\n\"use strict\";\n\nexports.info = {\n  name: \"externalserver\",\n  synchronous: true\n};\n\nexports.platforms = [\"node\"];\n\nif($tw.node) {\n  var Command = function(params,commander,callback) {\n    this.params = params;\n    this.commander = commander;\n    this.callback = callback;\n    // Commands that are just for the server\n    $tw.ServerSide = require('$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob/ServerSide.js');\n  };\n\n  Command.prototype.execute = function() {\n    var bobVersion = $tw.wiki.getTiddler('$:/plugins/OokTech/Bob').fields.version\n    console.log('TiddlyWiki version', $tw.version, 'with Bob version', bobVersion)\n    return null;\n  };\n\n  exports.Command = Command;\n}\n})();\n",

            "module-type": "command"
